Eyes you’ll shut forever.

tags: eh probably not the first one to discover this
summary: Will that be Arya's death at the end?
body:
Will that be Arya’s death at the end?

“You had best run back to your room, little sister. Septa Mordane will surely be lurking. The longer you hide, the sterner the penance. When the spring thaw comes, they will find your body with needle still locked tight between your frozen fingers.”

- Jon, in Arya’s first chapter, AGoT

reblog.comment:

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
asos is just a big book of pain
title: My Top 10 Saddest Arya Quotes
body:
* in no particular order*

1. “He was my friend,” Arya whispered into her plate, so low that no one could hear. Her ribs sat there untouched, grown cold now, a thin film of grease congealing beneath them on the plate. Arya looked at them and felt ill. She pushed away from the table.” - Arya II, AGoT

2. “For a moment she did not know how to answer. She’d had so many names. Had she only dreamed Arya Stark?” - Arya II, ASoS

3. “Lyanna was beautiful,” Arya said, startled. Everybody said so. It was not a thing that was ever said of Arya.”- Arya II, AGoT

4. “Arya didn’t know how much Robb would pay for her, though. He was a king now, not the boy she’d left at Winterfell with snow melting in his hair. And if he knew the things she’d done, the stableboy and the guard at Harrenhal and all … “What if my brother doesn’t want to ransom me?” - Arya VII, ASoS

5. “She could feel the hole inside her every morning when she woke. It wasn’t hunger, though sometimes there was that too. It was a hollow place, an emptiness where her heart had been, where her brothers had lived, and her parents. Her head hurt too. Not as bad as it had at first, but still pretty bad. Arya was used to that, though, and at least the lump was going down. But the hole inside her stayed the same. The hole will never feel any better, she told herself when she went to sleep.” - Arya XII, ASoS

6. “I have a hole where my heart should be, she thought, and nowhere else to go. “I’m strong. As strong as you. I’m hard.” - Arya II, AFfC

7. “ Needle was Robb and Bran and Rickon, her mother and her father, even Sansa. Needle was Winterfell’s grey walls, and the laughter of its people. Needle was the summer snows, Old Nan’s stories, the heart tree with its red leaves and scary face, the warm earthy smell of the glass gardens, the sound of the north wind rattling the shutters of her room. Needle was Jon Snow’s smile. He used to mess my hair and call me “little sister,” she remembered, and suddenly there were tears in her eyes.” - Arya II, AFfC

8. “And her lady mother, what would she say? Would she still want her back, after all the things she’d done? Arya chewed her lip and wondered.” - Arya IV, ASoS

9. “Aunt Lysa. The thought left Arya feeling empty. It was her mother she wanted, not her mother’s sister. She didn’t know her mother’s sister any more than she knew her great uncle Blackfish.” - Arya XII, ASoS

10. “The plaza was beginning to empty. The press dissolved around them as people drifted back to their lives. But Arya’s life was gone.”  - Arya V, AGoT

This is basically a long winded way of saying ASoS made me ugly cry.

And if he knew the things she’d done, the stableboy and the guard at Harrenhal and all … “What if my brother doesn’t want to ransom me?” - Arya VII, ASoS

5. “She could feel the hole inside her every morning when she woke. It wasn’t hunger, though sometimes there was that too. body:
Rereading A Game of Thrones

Rereading Arya’s first chapter was very interesting. Arya was clearly resents Sansa and jealous of her, and she blames the unfairness that happened to her on Sansa. And Arya completely misjudged her.

And Arya had a tiny crush on Joffrey.

reblog.comment:

trail.content_raw:

title: Stark family feels
body:
Me: Ok, ok, I’m good, I’m over it. Next GOT-obsession planned for 2019.

*five minutes later*

Me: Ned would be so proud of his girls…

Me: *openly sobs in public*

reblog.comment:
Me: Ok, ok, I’m good, I’m over it. Next GOT-obsession planned for 2019.

*five minutes later*

Me: Ned would be so proud of his girls…

Me: *openly sobs in public*

Me: *openly sobs in public*
